header: Americans spend 11 billion dollars a year on bottled water. Much of this is driven by celebrity endorsements, advertising, and PR campaigns crafted to weaken people's perception of tap water. Faucet Face is a reusable bottle company I created to combat this.

text: Faucet Face is a social enterprise I founded to reduce plastic bottle waste. I built the brand from the ground up, handling everything from finding manufacturers to sales, and bringing on artists to bring my ideas to life.
To date, the bottles have sold at Fab, Urban Outfitters, Modcloth, Paper Source, Trina Turk, and many other places.

What sets Faucet Face apart is its heart. Every bottle sold helps a family in rural India get 100 liters of clean water, thanks to our biosand filter initiative. These simple concrete filters get rid of up to 99% of bacteria and viruses in the water.
I sold Faucet Face a few years ago, but the new owner is keeping our mission alive, making sure every sale still supports clean water for families in need.
